greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Moebius function of the multiorder of integer partitions indexed by their Heinz numbers.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1,...,y_k) is prime(y_1)*...*prime(y_k).
formula: mu(y) = Sum_{g(t)=y} (-1)^d(t), where the sum is over all enriched p-trees (A289501, A299203) whose multiset of leaves is the integer partition y, and d(t) is the number of non-leaf nodes in t.
example: Heinz number of (2,1,1) is 12, so mu(2,1,1) = a(12) = 2.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Feb 05 2018
